critique: The document is an executive order that exempts Paul A. Walker from compulsory retirement. This is a fairly neutral document with regards to political bias. The order itself doesn't explicitly promote any particular ideology. However, the decision to extend the term of a member of the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) could be seen as an expansion of executive power, depending on the context and the specific powers of the FCC member. There is a slight tilt towards federalism as it involves a federal agency and a decision made at the federal level.
